home:
**[Join the community](https://appsterdam.rs/join-community/)**
We are 4,500 members of makers, designers and developers.
App makers helping app makers -  come join our community!
                
**[Collaborate](https://appsterdam.rs/collaborate/)**
Do you have an SDK, API or plugin that you want to share with Appsterdamers?
Contact us if you want to host a workshop or guru session.
                
**[Share a project](https://appsterdam.rs/shared-projects/)**
Our members are always developing new projects, products and solutions.
Check out the projects they are most proud of here.

members.name: Mike Lee
members.bio:
Mike Lee founded Appsterdam in 2011 as part of Amsterdam-based software house Sofa BV, and facilitated our conversion to a community-owned foundation after Sofa’s acquisition by Facebook.

As Mayor of Appsterdam, Mike is our coordinator of coordinators and moral figurehead, famously dispensing insightful advice and delicious baked treats.

Mike is an Apple Design Award winning software engineer with over 25 years experience; a well known public speaker who has pushed the envelope on what can be discussed at technology conferences; and a respected teacher on a wide array of social, business, and technical topics.

Mike grew up in Honolulu, Hawaii, and worked in Silicon Valley before settling in the Netherlands. Mike’s varied interests include lemurs, LEGO, and tools.

members.name: Tom van Arman
members.bio:
Tom has been organizing tech events for the Appsterdam Community since 2014. From popular guru sessions to large scale civic hacks, Tom is passionate to organize events like the Appsterdam Smart City Hackathon, Museum Night Hackathon, Smart Energy Hackathon and Amsterdam’s first Drone Day event.

As an urban planner and technologist, Tom uses IoT, AI, API’s and open data to as a design tool to create more livable and inclusive cities. In 2010 he founded Tapp, an award winning smart city design agency enabling local governments and industries to bridge the gap between the built environment and new digital landscape. Today, Tom works as a Smart City Architect developing cutting edge technologies for the City of Amsterdam and partners like The Marineterrein (former Navy Yard), AMS-Institute (Advance Metropolitan Solutions) and AMdEX data exchange w/ Amsterdam Economic Board.

Tom is the Treasurer for Stichting Appsterdam and serves on the Board.

members.name: Wesley de Groot
members.bio:
Hi i'm **Wesley**,

I'm a code 🥷, developer, hacker.
Who loves to create and build things.
_(like this api, the apps and website 😉)_

I'm trying to start a [programming blog](https://wdg.codes).

p.s. did you know that this is Markdown?

I'm one of the organizers of Weekend Fun and i serves on the Appsterdam Board.

members.name: Jacqueline de Gruijter
members.bio:
For the past 10 years Jacqueline de Gruyter has been immersed in the world of mobile apps.
As the founder and programmer of the Appril festival she built connections between the crème de la crème of the Dutch app scene.

She invited inspiring speakers to talk about all aspects of realizing an app: from idea, design and coding, to the final launch.
With her work, she brings together technical and non-technical experts and stimulates innovation.

Since 2019, she has been working on both the App festival ‘Appril’. Together with Ivo Jansch she has been involved with organising Appdevcon, an event for app developers with software development as the central focus.

Jacqueline’s work is about inspiring, connecting and growing as an professional.
From developing a training course, a soft skill training, app festival programming or resumé improvement

Good craftsmanship and new, innovative ideas motivate her. Whether it’s the design of a wooden chair, a painting or a technical solution. 
The last few years Jacqueline has also focused on supporting app professionals with finding new jobs or projects.
She also organised a ‘soft skills’ program for app developers, focused on developing additional skills important in furthering their career.

She has also been active in creating podcasts with the app community and committing her time to Appsterdam finding new partnerships.

Do you like to connect with her or her network, ask a question or plan an online meeting?

Feel free to contact her at: [jacqueline@appsterdam.rs](mailto:jacqueline@appsterdam.rs)

members.name: Maike Warner
members.bio:
After years being in the art field, Maike has used technology to design and create projects. The ease in which she adapted new tools and methods came in handy when she decided to learn iOS development to build an app she saw missing in the marketplace, together with Wesley.
This led to learning many distinctions around programming, version control, frontend, UI and UX Design. Maike spent many Saturdays in the Appsterdam MeetUp as a newbie, to leading it, which she continues to this day. It was in Appsterdam that Maike connected with and developed mad respect for developers. She loves to be with them, whether it be to talk tech or life.
It is her great joy to be able to support passionate developers, whether it is in finding jobs or just catching up and learn about development!

members.name: Jake Ruston
members.bio:
As the director of JRustonApps, Jake has been in the mobile app industry for over ten years. He has a wide range of experience in iOS and Android app development, with a particular focus on travel and weather.

Being one of the weekend fun organizers, you'll often find him at Appsterdam's family-friendly events as well as the 'Meeten en Drinken' sessions.

members.name: James Bennett
members.bio:
A tech stack fashionista 💃 I like shiny new toys. So I develop apps with Jetpack Compose, SwiftUI, Kotlin Multiplatform (KMM), and Flutter!
Most of my professional experience has been on Android 🤖 
🇬🇧🇫🇮
